page.content: exemplify this fact. The pupils completed questionnaires showing the pattern of their relatives' emigration in recent years. It was found that 13% of them had relatives who had moved to the East of Scotland, rapidly becoming more affluent due to the rise of oil and high-tech industries in these areas. The same percentage moved to the South-east of England, attracted by the good job prospects and a higher standard of living. The traditional countries for Scots emigrants are Canada and Australia, and 54% of the pupils had relatives in North America or Australasia. These countries have had to tighten their immigration rules as the world recession has caused unemployment in their own countries. This has stemmed the flow of emigrants in recent years.
